text.text: The place is convenient for everyone one with every age to read or borrow the book for library member. There is give chance to exchange book as well which everyone could donate books been read and take others book donate by others. There is 3 floors building and providing books from children to adults with various topics.

text.text:
A Convenient Library that caters for the
Heartlanders residing in Toa Payoh.
It's existing in the Toa Payoh Central has been since the 1970s.

originalText.text:
A Convenient Library that caters for the
Heartlanders residing in Toa Payoh.
It's existing in the Toa Payoh Central has been since the 1970s.

text.text:
‚ö´Ô∏è Toa Payoh Public Library is a library building located in Toa Payoh Central and it was opened in 1974.üü® It consists of three floors of reading materials.

üü¶ Toa Payoh or Â§ßÂ∑¥Á™ë library is also within walking distance of the HDB Hub, Toa Payoh Bus Interchange and Toa Payoh MRT station. ‚û°Ô∏èüåø It takes about 8 mins approximately to walk from Toa Payoh Bus Interchange to the library.

üü®  The library went under major renovation in 1997, before re-opening in 1999.

üôáüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è This is the library that my late father used to take me to when I was in primary school in the 1970s. ‚ùáÔ∏è Every Saturday afternoon, my father would take me to the library and we would spend at least 2 hours there.

üü® The library has changed alot over the decades. In the 1970s, there weren't so many books like now. ‚û°Ô∏è Because Singapore was not that affluent in those days. We only had a certain amount of resources for public library administration and finance.

‚ú≥Ô∏è But I am very happy to see my Toa Payoh Library grow over the years to a full fledged library catering to readers of all ages.

text.text:
Went on a weekday and the library is cozy and spacious with plenty of seats.

As one of the oldest libraries in Singapore, the looks on the outside may cause this place to seem a little rundown, however the amenities inside looks quite new and there‚Äôs even a section for children and elderly.

I love the libraries in Singapore because of how the books are generally all quite neatly arranged, making it quick and easy to find books, especially if you use the NLB app!

However, I wish that there would be more stocks for some of the more popular books since they‚Äôre always reserved, on loan, or unavailable.

However, I wish that there would be more stocks for some of the more popular books since they‚Äôre always reserved, on loan, or unavailable.

text.text: My favorite place to go wherever I am. Very comfy and cozy place to spend time. And the most important is, it have lots of variation of books I can explore with. And don't forget to bring your jacket when you want to spend time inside library üòä
